Description: Limestone ostracon: from the body of a vessel, with remains of eight lines of black-painted hieratic text on one side. Part of a journal of the neocropolis mentioning the workman Pennub, the scribe Ramose and rations.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: B.J.J. Haring, 'Hieratic Varia', Journal of Egyptian Archaeology 90 (2004), pp.215-19. On the acquisition see: B. Muhs and T. Vorderstrasse,' Collecting Egyptian Antiquities in the year 1838: Reverend William Hodge Mill and Robert Curzon, Baron Zouche', Journal of Egyptian Archaeology (2008), pp. 223-245.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (136182) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/136182)
